thread.title: EU demands 'immediate' halt to Russia strikes
thread.title_full: EU demands 'immediate' halt to Russia strikes

author: tribuneindia.com
title: EU demands 'immediate' halt to Russia strikes
text: Luxembourg: The EU demanded on Monday the "immediate" halt of Russian air strikes against moderate Syrian rebel groups, adding that a lasting peace was impossible under Moscow-backed President Bashar al-Assad. "The recent Russian military attacks that go beyond Daesh (Islamic State) and other UN-designated terrorist groups, as well as on the moderate opposition, are of deep concern and must cease immediately," the EU's 28 foreign ministers said. AFP 5 Islamists held for attack on Christian priest Dhaka: Five suspected Islamists were arrested in Bangladesh in connection with last week's attempt on the life of a pastor and one of them has confessed to the attack, saying they wanted to defame the government and create a "sensation in Western world. The Jamaatul Islam Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) member, who pastor Luke Sarker identified as 23-year-old Rakib, confessed to his involvement in the assassination attempt. PTI Scotland Yard stop guarding Assange hideout London: Scotland Yard have stopped guarding the Ecuadorean embassy in London where fugitive WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has been holed up since 2012 but the UK police maintain they will still use "overt and covert tactics" to arrest him. The police has maintained a permanent police presence outside the mission since Assange sought refuge there to evade extradition to Sweden on rape charges. PTI China plans to remove poverty by 2020 Beijing: China will eradicate poverty completely by 2020 as it plans to lift nearly 70.17 million people living in the countryside above the poverty line, officials of the ruling Communist party said. Leaders of the Communist Party of China (CPC) will gather from October 26 to 29 in Beijing for a key meeting to finalise the country's development plan for the next five years. PTI
